question: Which of the following is a set of vectors?

Two points on a velocity time-graph have coordinates (5s, 10ms<sup>-1</sup>) and (20s, 20ms<sup>-1</sup>). Calculate the mean acceleration between the two points

question: A block-and-tackle system is used to lift a load of 20N through a vertical height of 10m. if the efficiency of the system is 40%, how much work is done against friction?
explanation:
Efficiency = \(\frac{output}{input}\) x 100

40 = \(\frac{20\times10}{input}\) x \(\frac{100}{1}\)

input = 500J

work against friction = input - output

= 500 - 200 = 300J

A mass of gas at 7<sup>o</sup>C and 70cm of mercury has a volume of 1200cm<sup>3</sup>. Determine its volume at 27<sup>o</sup>C and pressure of 75cm of mercury.

An electric heater is used to melt a block of ice of mass 1.5kg. If the heater is powered by a 12V battery and a current of 20A flows through the coil, calculate the time taken to melt the block of ice at 0<sup>o</sup>C. [specific latent heat of fusion of ice = 336 x 10<sup>3</sup>Jkg<sup>-1</sup>]
explanation:
Elect. energy = heat energy

IVt = mL

20 X 12 t = 1.5 x 336 x 103

t = 2100 sec ; t = 35mins.

options: form of energy and is proportional to the total kinetic energy of the molecules
form of energy and is proportional to the average kinetic energy of the molecules

question: A vibrator of frequency 60Hz is used in generating transverse stationary waves in a long thin wire, If the average distance between successive nodes on the wire is 45cm, find the speed of the transverse waves in the wire.
When the tension in a sonometer wire is doubled, the ratio of the new frequency to the initial frequency is
In a sound wave in air, the adjacent rarefactions and compressions are separated by a distance of 17cm. If the velocity of the sound wave is 340ms<sup>-1</sup>. Determine the frequency
Light of wavelength 5000 x 10<sup>-8</sup>cm travels in free space with a velocity of 3 x 10<sup>8</sup>ms<sup>-1</sup>. What is its wavelength in glass of refractive index 1.5?
explanation:
n = \(\frac{\text{wavelength in space}}{\text{wavelength in glass}}\)

1.5 = \(\frac{5000 \times 10^{-8}}{\lambda g}\)

\(\lambda\)g = 3333 x 10-8cm

question: The magnification of the image of an object placed in front of a convex mirror is \(\frac{1}{3}\). If the radius of curvature of the mirror is 24cm, what is the distance between its object and its image?
explanation:
F = uv ; v = 1u

12 = \(\frac{v + 3v}{v + 3v}\)

v = 16cm, u = 48cm

distance between U and V

= 48 - 16 =32cm

question: The plane mirrors in a kaleidoscope are usually placed
A far sighted person cannot see objects that are less than 100cm away. If this person wants to read a book at 25cm, what type and focal length of lens does he need?
When a yellow card is observed through a blue glass, the card would appear.
explanation: Yellow light is a mixture of red and green light, hence, yellow will reflect red and green light. This means that a yellow object will appear red under red light, and green under green light. Yellow does not contain blue, so it will appear black under blue light.

options: different speeds of the various colours in glass

options: carry the same magnitude and sign of charge

question: When a number of identical small magnets are arranged in a line, the strength of the resultant magnet
options: ia largest when they are arranged end to end
is greatest when they are arrangedparallel with like poles adjacent to each other
depends only on the number of magnets provided they arev parallel
is greater when the magnets are arranged on a wooden surface than on a metaln surface

question: A bar magnet is most effectively demagnetized by
options: placing it in a N - 5 position and hitting it with a hammer
subjecting it to an electric current from a battery
bringing its north pole in contact with the north pole of a very strong magnet

question: The resistance of a 5m uniform wire of cross-sectional area 0.2 x 10-6m2 is 0.425. What is the resistivity of the material of the wire?
explanation:
Resistance = \(\frac{\text{ Resistivity x Area}}{Area}\)

= 0.425 x 0.2 x 10-6

= 1.7 x 10-8\(\Omega\)m

question: Three resistors, with substances 250\(\Omega\), 500\(\Omega\) and 1k\(\Omega\) are connected in series. A 6V battery is connected to either end of the combination. Calculate the pot3ential difference between the end of the 250\(\Omega\) resistor.
A calibrated potentiometer is used to measure the e.m.f. of a cell because the
options: internal resistance of a cell is small compared with that of the potentiometer
potentiometer takes no current from the cell
resistance of the potentiometer is less than that of a voltmeter

question: An ammeter of resistance 1.0\(\Omega\) has a full-scale deflection of 50mA. Determine the resultant full-scale deflection of the meter when a shunt of 0.0111\(\Omega\) is connected across its terminals.
explanation:
V = 0.1 x 50 x 10-3= 5 x 10-3volts

RT= \(\frac{0.1 \times 0.0111}{0.1 + 0.0111}\)

= 9.99 x 10-3\(\Omega\)

V = IR \(\Rightarrow\) I

= \(\frac{5 \times 10^{-3}}{9.9 \times 10^{-3}}\)

= 0.5A ; = 500mA

settle in a fixed direction WHETHER the conductor PQ is a magnetic material OR NOT

explanation: studying the charges of the Gamma, Alpha, Beta and X-rays, you find that both the x-rays and theGamma rays possess zero-charge hence they could pass the charged plate undetected while the beta rays are negatively charged hence will deflect towards the positive charge of the plate. Alpha rays, on the other hand, are poisitively charged hence, they deflect towards the negative charge.
